Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

main.read_root()[source]¶

Read the root endpoint.

This function handles GET requests to the root URL (“/”) and returns a simple JSON message.

Returns:

A dictionary containing a welcome message.

Return type:

dict

async main.startup()[source]¶

Initialize the Redis connection and FastAPI limiter on startup.

This function is executed during the startup event of the FastAPI application. It initializes a Redis connection using the host and port settings from the configuration, and then initializes the FastAPILimiter with this Redis instance.

Raises:

redis.ConnectionError – If the Redis server is unreachable.

REST API repository Notes¶

async str.repository.notes.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact[source]¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The data for the contact to create.

  • user (User) – The user to create the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async str.repository.notes.find_email(contact_email: str, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None[source]¶

Retrieves a contact matching the given email for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_email (str) – Email of the contact to search.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Returns the first contact matching the given email, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

Retrieves a contact matching the given name for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_name (str) – The name of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Returns the first contact matching the given first name or last name., or None if it does not exist.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Contact | None

async str.repository.notes.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact][source]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve conatcts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async str.repository.notes.get_upcoming_birthdays(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact] | None[source]¶

Retrieves a list of 7-days-upcoming contacts birthdays for a specific user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts birthdays, or None, if not exist upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[Contact]|None

async str.repository.notes.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None[source]¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user. :param contact_id: The ID of the contact to remove. :type contact_id: int :param user: The user to remove the contact for. :type user: User :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: The removed contact, or None if it does not exist. :rtype: Contact | None

  • body (ContactModel) – The updated data for the contact.

  • user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

REST API routes Auth¶

async str.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Confirm a user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The token sent to the user’s email for confirmation.

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session dependency.

Returns:

A confirmation message.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the verification fails or the email is already confirmed.

async str.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Authenticate a user and return JWT tokens.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The OAuth2 password request form containing login credentials.

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session dependency.

Returns:

The access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the email is invalid, email is not confirmed, or the password is invalid.

async str.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Refresh JWT tokens.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – The HTTP authorization credentials containing the refresh token.

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session dependency.

Returns:

The new access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the refresh token is invalid or does not match the stored token.

async str.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Request email confirmation.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – The request email model containing the user’s email.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – The background tasks dependency for sending the confirmation email.

  • request (Request) – The request object to get the base URL.

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session dependency.

Returns:

A message indicating that the confirmation email has been sent.

Return type:

dict

async str.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Create a new user account.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The user model containing user registration data.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – The background tasks dependency for sending confirmation email.

  • request (Request) – The request object to get the base URL.

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session dependency.

Returns:

The created user and a success message.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If an account with the given email already exists.

REST API routes Notes¶

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session dependency.

  • current_user (User, optional) – The current authenticated user dependency.

Returns:

The created contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async str.routes.notes.find_contacts(query: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))[source]¶

This function searches for contacts that match the given query (name or surname) for the current authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • query (str.) – The query string to search for in contact names or surnames.

  • db (Session.) – The database session.

  • current_user (User.) – The current authenticated user dependency.

Returns:

The contact that match the query.

Return type:

Contact.

Raises:

HTTPException – If no contacts are found that match the query, raises a 404 HTTP exception.

  • db (Session) – The database session dependency.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user dependency.

Returns:

The contact found with the given email.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If no contacts are found with the given email.

REST API service Auth¶

class str.services.auth.Auth[source]¶

Bases: object

A class for handling authentication operations, including password verification, token creation, and user retrieval.

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)[source]¶

Generate a new access token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to encode in the token.

  • expires_delta (float, optional) – The expiration time in seconds. If not provided, defaults to 15 minutes.

Returns:

The encoded access token.

Return type:

str

create_email_token(data: dict)[source]¶

Create a token for email verification.

Parameters:

data (dict) – The data to encode in the token.

Returns:

The encoded email token.

Return type:

str

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)[source]¶

Generate a new refresh token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to encode in the token.

  • expires_delta (float, optional) – The expiration time in seconds. If not provided, defaults to 7 days.

Returns:

The encoded refresh token.

Return type:

str

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)[source]¶

Decode a refresh token and retrieve the email.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – The refresh token.

Returns:

The email encoded in the token.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or its scope is incorrect.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password.

Returns:

REST API service Email¶

async str.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)[source]¶

Send a confirmation email to the user.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The email address to send the confirmation to.

  • username (str) – The username of the recipient.

  • host (str) – The host URL to include in the email.

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – If there is an error connecting to the email server.
